metadata.Title: CVE-2022-33740 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Linux disk/nic frontends data leaks T[his CNA information record relates tomultiple CVEs; the text explains which aspects/vulnerabilities correspondto which CVE.] Linux Block and Network PV device frontends don't zeromemory regions before sharing them with the backend (CVE-2022-26365,CVE-2022-33740). Additionally the granularity of the grant table doesn'tallow sharing less than a 4K page, leading to unrelated data residing inthe same 4K page as data shared with a backend being accessible by suchbackend (CVE-2022-33741, CVE-2022-33742).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-33740` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-48-generic - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-5.15.0-48-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-48-generic - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-48-generic-64k - 5.15.0-48.54
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1018-kvm - 5.15.0-1018.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1020-aws - 5.15.0-1020.24
No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1018-gcp - 5.15.0-1018.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1016-gke - 5.15.0-1016.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1003-gkeop - 5.15.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1015-ibm - 5.15.0-1015.17
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1016-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1016.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-48-lowlatency - 5.15.0-48.54
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-48-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-48.54
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1018-oracle - 5.15.0-1018.23

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-48.54').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.22').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1020.24').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1020.25').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1020.25').
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.24').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1016.19').
linux-gkeop package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1003.5').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1015.17').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1016.21').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-48.54').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1018.23').
linux-oem-5.17: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needed').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1015.17').
xen package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needs-triage').
